steps: Learn Kotlin basics: variables, functions, classes, null safety.
Practice collections, data classes, sealed classes.
Build a small app feature (login screen) using Kotlin only.
Learn coroutines basics (launch, suspend, async/await).

why: Modern Android UI toolkit used in most new projects.
steps: Understand Composable functions and state (remember, mutableStateOf).
Build a simple UI: list + details screen.
Learn layouts: Column, Row, LazyColumn, modifiers.
Add navigation-compose between screens.

why: Keeps UI and logic separated for maintainable apps.
steps: Understand ViewModel responsibilities (state, events).
Create UI state data classes and StateFlow.
Implement repository layer for data access.
Refactor one screen to MVVM with clean state updates.

why: Essential for teamwork and version control.
steps: Practice add/commit/push/pull.
Create branches and open a pull request.
Learn resolving merge conflicts.
Use .gitignore correctly and keep commits small.
Understand HTTP methods, status codes, headers.
Use Retrofit to call an API and parse JSON.
Handle loading, error and success states.
Add pagination or search to practice real API usage.
Learn SELECT, WHERE, JOIN, GROUP BY.
Practice on sample tables (users, orders).
Learn indexes and basic query optimization.
Create a small project: store and query data for reporting.
Learn Dockerfile basics and build an image.
Run a container and map ports.
Use docker-compose for multi-service setup.
Containerize a small API + database locally.
